result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary L Decker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit for 1 day granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.

Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through AODA treatment as required by Agent.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed and must be verified to Agent at every appointment.

No contact with co-defendant.  Follow through on disability application of maintain part-time employment.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-Working Hours with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS-STAYED for use by Agent.
To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by agent.

Certificate of completion for Making it Work program on 8/1/14
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Mary L Decker in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.
- 3 years Probation. 
- Cash bail to be applied to costs and surcharges.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- Court costs of $268.00; cash bail to be applied.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00; cash bail to be applied.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed and must be verified to Agent at every appointment.  Follow through with AODA treatment as required by Agent.  No contact with codefendant.  Follow through on disability application or maintain part-time employment.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
- 50 hours Community Service
CONDITION TIME: 90 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.

to be done within 60 days.

Defendant Mary L Decker in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1. Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant guilty of count 1. Counts 2, 3, and 4 dismissed and read-in. Parties request a presentence report. Court orders presentence report to be done within 60 days. Court addressed W.C.S. report with defendant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.
